front.title: The Time Zone Data Distribution Service (TZDIST) Geolocate Extension

abstract.t: This document defines an extension to the Time Zone Data Distribution Service (RFC 7808) to allow a client to determine the correct time zone for a geographic point location using a 'geo' URI (RFC 5870). Open Issues o Does the 'geo' URI value have to be percent-encoded? o Should we advertise the supported coordinate reference systems (and if so, how?) or simply mandate crs=wgs84? o Should we discuss territorial and/or international waters? o What, if any, additional security and privacy concerns are introduced by this extension?
